revised_title: Chloramphenicol Resistance in Bacteria: Adaptive and Lethal Processes
tldr: The study investigates the development of chloramphenicol resistance in bacteria, specifically \lt;italic\gt;Bact. lactis aerogenes\lt;/italic\gt;. The research explores the adaptive and lethal processes in liquid media and on agar plates, suggesting that the resistance is not due to pre-existing mutants but rather the result of a competition between adaptive and lethal processes. The findings support the adaptive hypothesis for the development of drug resistance with this agent and organism.
